cyclone.name: IDA
cyclone.current_location: about 75 miles south of the mouth of the Mississippi River
cyclone.trajectory: Continuing northwest across the north-central Gulf toward southeast Louisiana, then slowing and turning north and northeast over Louisiana and western Mississippi Monday–Tuesday
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: southeast Louisiana coast near Port Fourchon/Lafourche Parish

weather_observation.watch_coast: N/A (no watch currently in effect for the port)
weather_observation.warning_coast: Hurricane Warning – Intracoastal City, LA to the Mouth of the Pearl River, including Lake Pontchartrain, Lake Maurepas, and Metropolitan New Orleans; Storm Surge Warning – Rockefeller Wildlife Refuge, LA eastward to the AL/FL border including Lake Borgne, Lake Pontchartrain, Lake Maurepas and Mobile Bay
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Northern Gulf Coast from eastern Texas to coastal Alabama, with greatest impacts across southeast Louisiana and the Mississippi coast
weather_observation.wind: Potentially catastrophic winds with sustained hurricane-force (≥74 mph) possible; 90-kt (105 mph) probabilities exceed 60% for the port area.
weather_observation.storm_surge: Lake Pontchartrain and adjacent tidal lakes forecast 5–8 ft; nearby Mississippi River delta 8–12 ft. New Orleans levee system expected to face significant water levels outside protected areas.
weather_observation.rainfall: 10–18 inches with isolated 24 inch totals forecast; life-threatening flash- and river-flooding likely in and around New Orleans.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Brief tornadoes possible Sunday–Monday; dangerous surf and life-threatening rip currents already occurring.
